alert.note: Alert for Etowah (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 02 at 2:44PM CDT until July 02 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Etowah. * WHEN...Until 545 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 244 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen over a short period of time. Heavy rain will continue as slow-moving storms move across the Gadsden area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gadsden, Rainbow City, Attalla, Glencoe, Steele, Gadsden Mall, Noccalula Falls, Neely Henry Lake, Southside, Gadsden Municipal Airport, Big Wills Creek, Gadsden Steam Plant, Gadsden Water Works, Northside and Ramsey.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
